intro: Cymbosema apurense, commonly known as the Apurean cymbosema, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests or near water sources. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
